did.unittitle: Charles D. Wrege History of Management Collection of Midvale Steel Company Photographs,
did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Includes Frederick W. Taylor, Henry S. Dennison, Midvale Steel Company site, buildings, surrounding areas, executives, offices, workers, train shipments, dining areas, laboratories, steam hammers, scientific management processes, medical services, steel working processes, munitions production, etc.

bioghist.p: Charles "Chuck" Wrege finished his undergraduate degree in Upsala College, obtained his Masters degree at the New School fo Social Research and another Masters of Business Administration and his Ph.D. at NYU. He taught industrial management at Rutgers University for 30 years. He became a renowned historian, researcher and writer. He is regarded as a "National Treasure" by many in his field because of his expertise and the seminal research he has done in the area of management history.

scopecontent.p: Includes Frederick W. Taylor, Henry S. Dennison, Midvale Steel Company site, buildings, surrounding areas, executives, offices, workers, train shipments, dining areas, laboratories, steam hammers, scientific management processes, medical services, steel working processes, munitions production, etc.

accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.p: Charles D. Wrege History of Management Collection of Midvale Steel Company Photographs #5618 P. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.
